column4: Rather than post the same question to the bottom of the other 20 same question on UbuntuFormus, does anyone else here have or had an issue with Windows 7 and connectiong from Ubuntu to the sahres on windows 7?  the post that is the same as my issue is --> http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-1043933.html
have you check whether samba officially supports Win 7?
checked*
negative I have not, but I would not have thought WIndows 7 RC1 would be much different to Vista as far as file sharing goes?
I have no idea, frankly I haven't used samba lately, and not to access Win 7. But yeah, Win 7 is (badly) patched Vista, so yeah :)
when I try and "map" a drive in Ubuntu using the "Connect to server option" this is what I get here now --> Cannot display location "smb://192.168.1.150/"  ->
Since one of vista's problems was file transfer over network (horribly slow, they say), it's logical to think they'd revamp that in Win 7. means samba wouldn't just work as it did with Vista
that address pingable?
win7 firewall disabled?
can the win7 computer see ubuntu too?
Firewall open and --> 64 bytes from 192.168.1.150: icmp_seq=1 ttl=128 time=1.63 ms
and win can ping ubuntu?
pinging the other way is fine too
smbtree also shows the Windows 7 box, but, no shars
can you pastebin you sambalogs?
should be somewhere under /var/logs
your*
--> http://pastebin.com/d532f938
that is the smbtree out
I need the logs, to where it failed
haha
